Bad Comments: fast , correct subbing(to the best of my knowlegde), the fact that their website is down 50% of the time is a downside, but the subs are perfect... clear fonts, perfect grammar 10

Subbed Projects.Show Name: Darker than Black: Kuro no Keiyakusha

Good Comments: Similar reasons to the other reviewers - _perfectly_ timed subtitles, nice font choice. Good raw video quality. The only drawbacks I noticed was a ~.2s video/audio desync in some episodes (easily enough corrected, if you are a freak like me who notices it
Bad Comments: Excellent wording and great font used.

Good Comments: the english might not be perfect, but it's really easy to understand and they've subbed all episodes ^^
Hard to read font..but overall it's a good release.
They actually take time to make sure the fansub looks great. Good TL.
Okay - but the font, while creative, was sometimes hard to read
Bad Comments: the font they use is hard to read and LOL vampire knight second season has started and they aren't even done with the last 3 eps of season 1... slow SUBS ARE SLOW!
Superb audio/visual quality, acceptable translations and creative typesetting font style. ^_^
My God, their translations are a total shit. A TOTAL shit.
The typeset was so terrible that I couldn't read their subtitles.

Good Comments: Great subtitles, including things like signs, subtitles on top of the original using similar font.Also, after an episode, there is a list of references one might have missed, some additional explanations.
very specialized subtitles, and they took fansubbing seriously
Bad Comments: I liked how they added notes at the end of the episode to further explain the Japanese folklore themes that were present in many episodes. And an excellent translation to boot!

i like this fansubs group! 
they'll write the preferences in the end of the episode :) i appreciate it!

Good Comments: Good translation, making it understandable for a normal guy like me. I don't like second-guessing myself with what other groups put in their subs.
their subs for xxxHOLiC (first season) was way better
Bad Comments: I'm getting mine from Shinsen, but Mishicorp is also a decent group.

What a nice fansub. They actually provided understandable translations- and for Japanese-know-how-only concepts (like how Mahjong works), they always had a concise note to explain it on the side. But they stop at 7 episodes, so see Shinsen after that.
